official-title.#text: To amend title 10, United States Code, to authorize the Secretary of Defense to provide seven person firing parties in the funeral honors details for World War II veterans.

sponsor.#tail: introduced the following bill; which was referred to the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Funeral Honors for World War II Veterans Act
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Funeral Honors for World War II Veterans Act

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

header.#text: Authority for inclusion of seven person firing parties in funeral honors details provided by Secretary of Defense for World War II veterans

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , is amended by adding at the end the following new sentence:

quote.#text: In the case of a veteran who served on active duty in the armed forces during World War II, the funeral honors detail may include a seven person firing party.

text.#text: The amendment made by subsection (a) shall apply with respect to deaths occurring after the date of the enactment of this Act.

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}title.#text: 113 HR 5760 IH: Funeral Honors for World War II Veterans Act

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}rights.#text: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
